children.subject: Thanks for the insight. Indeed 189 127 and 126 together is a bit too far, so would you suggest/have you taken cs188? How useful do you think it is?

I did take cs188, i think it serves as a good introduction to upper division courses which are a somewhat different flavor than lower divs. it's not too terribly difficult, and the projects are a lot of fun, and it covers pretty fundamental ideas in traditional AI
Ah I see, then I think I will go for cs188 then. Thanks for your suggestions.

worth noting that traditional ai doesn't really relate all that much to the concepts in 126 127 and 189 (you do a very very cursory introduction to neural networks in 188, and also cover HMMs) but still has its uses

re: taking 189 127 and 126 in the same semester: yikesyikesyikes. 3 very heavy problem set classes, with big workloads, and difficult material. you're a freshman, imo since you've already completed cs61a/b/c ee16a/b and cs70 you're way way ahead, and can afford to spread them out. i'm in 161, 127 and 189 this semester, and took 126 last semester, and i'm finding it manageable, not great, but manageable. I cannot fathom replacing 161 with 126.

history.content: Dude you really don't need to take 189 so early on. I'd recommend taking 126 and 127 before taking 189 (or at least 126 before). Those classes are the core maths that 189 is built on. 188 builds on other aspects of AI, namely graph problems and reinforcement learning, neither of which are covered in 189. Reinforcement learning is the big ML part missing in 189, so if you wanna go research at least, you should prob take 188 at some point. It also would be much more doable with 126 and 127 than 189 would be. Trust me, I know the desire to jump into the cool cs stuff like 189, but having a base would make it much more manageable.

Hi I am a freshman EECS. This semester I am taking cs61b, ee16b, math53, and r1b and I find the workload ok.

By the start of sophomore year I will have finished cs 61a/b/c, cs70, ee16a/b, and math53. Currently I am choosing courses for next semester. I already have my mind set on cs170 and cs61c, and I am planning to add a third technical course. Since I plan to take cs189 and eecs126 for the second semester of sophomore year, I am thinking about adding either cs188 or eecs127 for the first semester. Which one would be a better choice? 

I heard that many people don't take cs188 and jump directly into other machine learning courses because cs188 is relatively shallow. If it's true, will I be better off taking eecs127? 

If cs188 is a better option, would cs189, eecs127, and eecs126 together in one semester be manageable?
history.subject: Deciding between cs188 and eecs127
